definition: to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
communist attack against the Guomindang's encircle and annihilate campaign

sentences.english: Two time thorough hostile camp's results are single-handedly are encircled.
sentences.chinese: 兩次單槍匹馬深入敵營的結果都是被圍剿。

sentences.english: In the Fifth campaign he placed his entire reliance upon it.
sentences.chinese: 在第五次圍剿中，他就完全依賴這個了。

sentences.english: Contrary to my expectations, the argument didn't lead to an all-around ass-kicking.
sentences.chinese: 出乎我的意料，這場爭執並沒有招致全面圍剿。

sentences.english: As in the first enemy campaign, none of the forces were Chiang Kai-shek's own troops.
sentences.chinese: 和第一次“圍剿”時一樣，全部是蔣之非嫡系部隊。

sentences.english: I was alone and surrounded and I beat them.
sentences.chinese: 我單槍匹馬被圍剿，但我打敗了他們。

sentences.english: Shandong encirclement and suppression of column of the strategic plan is in abeyance.
sentences.chinese: 圍剿的山東縱隊的戰略計劃暫時擱置。

sentences.english: Political mobilization is a problem of prime importance in the struggle against " encirclement and suppression".
sentences.chinese: 政治動員是反“圍剿”鬥爭中第一個重要問題。

sentences.english: When forty winters shall beseige thy brow.
sentences.chinese: 待四十個冬季把你圍剿。

sentences.english: " At present, the ongoing anti-third "encirclement and suppression" of the struggle.
sentences.chinese: 目前，正在進行第三次反“圍剿”的鬥爭。

sentences.english: Findan will have to break their lines and lift the siege.
sentences.chinese: 芬丹必須設法突破敵人的防線，粉碎敵人的圍剿。

definition: Red Army (1928-1937), predecessor of the PLA/(Soviet) Red Army (1917-1946)
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to break a siege/to break out of an enclosure
Green Standard Army, standing infantry during Qing dynasty, originally formed from Ming and other Chinese army units
